name: North Carolina Teaching Fellows
description: The Teaching Fellows Program offers financial support, mentorship, and hands-on classroom experience to prepare future educators for leadership in North Carolina schools. Fellows study at top NC universities, receive forgivable loans, and join a statewide network with continued support beyond graduation.

name: NCCF Universal Scholarships
description: The NCCF Universal Scholarships Application outlines required materials, eligibility details, and key deadlines. It includes information on transcripts, recommendations, financial aid, intended majors, and the application timeline for NCCF-managed scholarships.

name: Roothbert Fund Scholarship
description: The Roothbert Fund provides scholarships to students in the U.S. who demonstrate financial need and live by strong spiritual values. Preference is given to students ho reside in or attend school in select states, including North Carolina.

name: Triangle Scholarship Fund
description: The Triangle Community Foundation scholarship supports one high school senior and one adult learner who demonstrate exceptional commitment to improving their community through service, work experience, and future goals.

name: Aubrey Lee Brooks Scholarships
description: Established in 1955, the Aubrey Lee Brooks Scholarships support graduating high school seniors from a 14-county area of North Carolina. Awards provide up to $12,000 per year, are renewable with continued eligibility, and include a one-time $2,500 computer stipend.

name: Ruff Ryders of Raleigh Scholarship Giveaway
description: The Ruff Ryders of Raleigh Scholarship supports graduating high school seniors in Wake County who demonstrate a strong commitment to community service, providing financial assistance to help further their education.

name: Achievement Scholarship for Refugees and Immigrants of Wake County
description: The Achievement Scholarship for Refugees and Immigrants in Wake County was created to support refugee and immigrant high school graduates pursuing postsecondary education in North Carolina. The scholarship provides financial assistance to full-time students attending accredited 2-year or 4-year colleges or technical institutions, helping them work toward meaningful careers and community involvement.

name: James M. Schooler, Sr Scholarship
description: The James M. Schooler, Sr. Scholarship was established by the Beta Theta Lambda Chapter of Alpha Phi Alpha Fraternity to support and encourage African American male students in their academic achievement. The scholarship is available to African American males residing in Durham County, North Carolina, who plan to pursue a four-year college degree.

name: Carol Ann Beerstecher Nursing Scholarship
description: The Carol Ann Beerstecher Nursing Scholarship Fund honors Carol Beerstecher’s dedication to the nursing profession by supporting students who share her passion for nursing. The scholarship provides financial assistance to individuals who may lack the resources to pursue a nursing career.

name: Elizabeth Marie Roberts Scholarship
description: The Elizabeth Marie Roberts Scholarship was created through Dr. Roberts’ Last Will and Testament to carry on her legacy of service by supporting students in the local community. It offers financial assistance to graduating seniors from Durham County, with recipients chosen based on their character, academic achievement, community involvement, and financial need. Preference is given to students planning to pursue degrees in health-related fields.

name: Felicia Brewer Opportunity Scholarship
description: The Felicia Brewer Opportunity Scholarship aims to provide a life-changing opportunity for immigrant or first-generation students who have faced and overcome significant challenges, enabling them to pursue their goals and improve their lives through education or training. The scholarship is awarded to students who attended a high school in the Chapel Hill–Carrboro City Schools or Chatham County Schools districts. This fund was established in memory of Felice (Felicia) Berkman Brewer by her father-in-law, Donald Brewer.

name: GSK Opportunity Scholarship
description: The GSK Opportunity Scholarship offers annual awards of up to $5,000, renewable for up to three additional years, to residents of the Triangle region (Chatham, Orange, Wake, and Durham counties). The scholarship supports individuals who have shown resilience in overcoming challenges and a strong commitment to advancing themselves through continued education or training.

name: iContact Foundation Scholarship
description: The iContact Foundation Scholarship Program provides competitive scholarships to children of current or former iContact employees and to residents of Chatham, Durham, Orange, or Wake County who are majoring in computer science. Recipients are selected based on financial need, community involvement and leadership, and academic merit.

name: Jason & Jessica Evans Memorial Scholarship
description: The Jason and Jessica Evans Memorial Scholarship honors the lives of Jason and Jessica Evans by supporting students who reflect their academic and personal excellence. Funded by the Evans family and community, recipients are chosen based on academic achievement, community and extracurricular involvement, potential for success, and financial need.

name: North Carolina American Indian Fund Scholarship
description: Established in 2001, the North Carolina American Indian Fund Scholarship supports American Indian students pursuing higher education. Recipients are selected based on community commitment, extracurricular and volunteer involvement, financial need, and academic achievement.

name: North Carolina Jaycees Outstanding Teenager Scholarship
description: The Five Outstanding Teenagers Awards program honors exceptional high school seniors, nominated by Jaycee chapters, who demonstrate excellence in academics, leadership, and community service. Winners are recognized by the NC Jaycees at the Mid-Year Convention in Roxboro.

name: Susan Ellis Roberts Scholarship
description: Created in memory of educator Susan Ellis Roberts, this scholarship honors a Wake County public school graduating senior who demonstrates creativity and special talent in the visual or performing arts. It is intended to support students who may not fit a traditional mold but show exceptional artistic potential.

name: Umesh and Usha Gulati Scholarship
description: The Usha and Umesh Gulati Scholarship supports graduating seniors or alumni from select Durham high schools who plan to attend Durham Tech. Recipients are chosen based on financial need and a strong motivation to succeed in higher education.

name: Benjamin F. Ward Scholarship
description: Funded by a gift from Mr. Ward’s estate, this scholarship honors his commitment to education and community service. It supports high school seniors from Durham, Orange, Wake, or Chatham County who plan to attend a four-year college or university in North Carolina and demonstrate financial need and dedication to community service.

name: Juanita McNeil West End Scholarship
description: The Juanita McNeil Scholarship honors the resilience of the West End Community and the legacy of Ms. McNeil’s leadership in community revitalization and engagement. It recognizes her efforts to create programs that supported hundreds of students and families.

name: Almac Scholarship
description: The Almac Scholarship Fund supports first-year college students in the Triangle region who demonstrate financial need and are pursuing four-year degrees at North Carolina public colleges or universities. In addition to financial support, the program offers career guidance, industry insight, and connections with Almac employees.

name: Tell Your Story Scholarship
description: The Tell Your Story Scholarship provides financial support to Sanderson High School students pursuing continued education, with a focus on those who have shown resilience in the face of adversity and a passion for helping others. Established in memory of a former Sanderson teacher, the scholarship honors her commitment to recognizing and celebrating each student’s unique strengths and stories.

name: Ann & Girard Tillery Scholarship
description: When Ann and Girard Tillery revised their wills, they chose to give back by supporting education, inspired by their mothers’ careers as educators. Created after Girard’s death in 2010, this scholarship provides higher education opportunities for individuals with financial need.

name: Florene Dickmeyer Memorial Scholarship
description: This scholarship supports students pursuing two-year community college or technical degrees who demonstrate hard work, generosity, and commitment to their community, with preference given to single mothers, refugees, and immigrants.

name: Marie Wood Memorial Scholarship
description: This scholarship supports students pursuing two-year community college or technical degrees who demonstrate hard work, generosity, and commitment, values believed to support long-term success in careers or business. Preference is given to first-generation college students and those seeking specific technical training.
